thread.title: LongIsland.com’s 2015 October Family Fun Guide: Tricks and Treats at LI’s Festivals, Hikes, and Spooky Halloween Haunts
thread.title_full: LongIsland.com’s 2015 October Family Fun Guide: Tricks and Treats at LI’s Festivals, Hikes, and Spooky Halloween Haunts

title: LongIsland.com’s 2015 October Family Fun Guide: Tricks and Treats at LI’s Festivals, Hikes, and Spooky Halloween Haunts
text: 37 West Main Street, Bay Shore, NY 11706 631-969-1101 Saturday, October 31st, 8:00 PM $35-40 per person Joe Louis Walker and Jay Geils will perform B.B. King’s hits at this limited-run event. Breast Cancer Awareness Events October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and there are many events happening across the Island in support of breast cancer survivors. There are 5Ks, dinners, symbolic ceremonies, and even free educational events open to the public to help people learn about advances in research and early detection! 121 West Broadway, Port Jefferson, NY 11777 631- 476-2723 Thursday, October 1st, 7:00 PM Free event The Village of Port Jeff will show their support for breast cancer awareness at this event, which is meant to bring together residents, organizations, and businesses to help spread awareness and education about early detection of breast cancer. 101 James Doolittle Boulevard, Uniondale, NY 11553 Thursday, October 1st, 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM Free event Support PinkTie.org by RSVPing for a rosé riot at the newly renovated Chardonnay Room at the Marriott. Business attire is required. Main Street on the Harbor, Stony Brook, NY 11790 Sunday, October 25th, 8:30 AM $25-45, depending on registration date Support a targeted research fund at Stony Brook Medicine for breast cancer research and the WMHO Unique Boutique for prosthesis and wigs by running or walking a 4K Color Splash, a 4K or 6K run or walk, or a 10K run! 101 East Main Street, Port Jefferson, NY 11777 October 1st – October 3rd, 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM Free event The Port Jeff Village Center is supporting an art gallery to represent victory against breast cancer by depicting breast cancer survivors and their art. The exhibition will continue for two months, and a public gala and education event will be held October 3rd from 4:00 PM to 7:00 PM 1 Independence Hill, Brookhaven, NY 11738 631-751-2244 Thursday, October 1st, 2:00 PM Free event This ceremony, led by Supervisor Edward P. Romaine and Councilwoman Valerie M. Cartwright, will honor those who lost their lives to breast cancer. It will include the release of birds with messages symbolizing the hope in the fight against breast cancer. 200 Sunrise Highway, Lindenhurst, NY 11757 631-893-4110 Thursday, October 1st, 6:30 PM – 8:00 PM Free event The torch will be passed from Ovarian Awareness to Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and teal and pink flags will be available for purchase, which will support the Babylon Breast Cancer Coalition. 1843 Deer Park Avenue, Deer Park, NY 11729 631-893-4110 Saturday, October 3rd, 4:00 PM – 7:00 PM $10 per person All are welcome (whether you are participating in the race or not) to enjoy a delicious spaghetti dinner, along with a DJ and raffles. 3845 Veterans Memorial Highway, Ronkonkoma, NY 11779 Saturday, October 3rd, 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM $25 per person This anime and fantasy convention is all in good fun, but has the serious underlying mission to educate young women about the importance of awareness regarding women’s cancers. The convention will include guests like famous voice-over artist Robert Axelrod, videogame room tournaments, and cosplay competitions. 1400 Prospect Avenue, East Meadow, NY 11554 Sunday, October 4th, 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM Free event Shop at over 50 vendors, and enjoy live music, games, raffles, food, and more, all of which goes to support the American Cancer Society and Making Strides Against Breast Cancer. 44 Fairway Drive, Port Jefferson, NY 11777 631-476-2723 Monday, October 5th, 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM $350 per person Support the Fortunato Breast Health Center at Mather Hospital through awareness and donations. 341 Main Street, Islip, NY 11751 631-224-5240 Monday, October 5th, 12:00 PM – 1:00 PM Free event Registration is required for this talk regarding updates in breast cancer research, which will be conducted by Drs. David Mangiameli and Melissa Fana. 7725 Jericho Turnpike, Woodbury, NY 11797 516-921-1415 Wednesday, October 7th, 6:30 PM – 9:30 PM $50 per person Put on your best witch hat and meet up with other ladies to sip cocktails, eat, network, raise awareness for breast cancer, and win prizes! 111 Main Street, Stony Brook, NY 11790 Thursday, October 15th, 6:00 PM – 9:00 PM Free event Come out for a great evening of live music, special cocktails, free gifts, raffles, goodie bags and much more all to benefit breast cancer research. 345 Deer Park Avenue, Babylon, NY 11702 631-893-4110 Tuesday, October 20th, 7:00 PM – 9:00 PM $45 per person Learn to paint a morning sun masterpiece with friends – no experience necessary! $15 from the entry fee will go to the Babylon Breast Cancer Coalition. LIAP Conference Center - Mather Hospital, 75 North Country Road, Port Jefferson, NY 11777 631-473-1320 Thursday, October 29th, 6:30 PM Free event At this free educational seminar, everyone and anyone is invited to RSVP and come listen to Avid L. Specter, PhD of Cold Spring Harbor to learn about medical advancements in the world of breast cancer. Other Outdoor October Fall Fun With the temperatures steadily dropping, now is the time for a cool walk in the woods with friends. There will be educational walks, as well as couples walks, and fun Halloween activities to join in on. 625 Belmont Ave. (Exit 38 off Southern State Pkwy), West Babylon, NY 11704 631-667-5055 Saturday, October 24th, 4:00 PM - 6:00 PM Free event Bring the family for a Halloween event featuring balloon twisting, a children’s spooky den, trick or treating, games, environmental crafts, and funny photos. The first 50 carved pumpkins of the night will be placed on flotation devices and lit with candles, then sailed around Belmont Lake at dusk. 2201 Devon Street, East Meadow, NY 11554 516-655-0334 Sunday, October 25th, 9:00 AM - 10:45 AM $10-25 per person This family-friendly 5K and fun run takes place on the streets of East Meadow. The school opens at 7:30 AM for registration, and the Fun Run starts at 8:30 AM, followed by the 5K at 9:00 AM. Muttontown Road and Route 106 (south of 25A), East Norwich, NY 11791 631-592-9804 Sunday, October 25th, 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM $5 per person Explore the ruins of a former mansion on the preserve while also meeting new people! Be sure to dress for the weather and pack a water bottle, lunch, and blanket or chair. 194 Bayville Road, Lattington, NY 11560 516-801-1458 Sunday, October 4th, 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM $10 per person Take a walk in the woods and go on some scavenger hunts that will show you the scope of the colors of trees in Fall. Robert Moses Parkway, Lot #5, Babylon, NY 11702 631-661-4876 Sunday, October 10th, 9:00 AM $15 for FLIPS members/$20 for non-members Follow a present day lightkeeper along the grounds of Robert Moses State Park as you learn about the inner workings of a lighthouse and the lives of those who care for them! Sunken Meadow State Parkway, Kings Park, NY 11754 914-835-2153 Sunday, October 18th, 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM $20 suggested donation for adults, $10 for kids under 12 “Wildman” Steve Brill will lead one of his world-famous foraging tours of Sunken Meadow and educate guests on all types of edible plants. Southern State Parkway, exit 38, North Babylon, NY 11703 914-835-2153 Saturday, October 31st, 11:30 AM - 2:30 PM $20 suggested donation for adults, $10 for kids under 12 This three-hour walking tour begins at the benches between the concession stand and the main parking lot, and will take visitors on a tour of the edibles that can be found on Long Island. Call for reservations. Halloween Fun 2015 Halloween Guide Get your spooky on in a variety of haunted hot spots, ranging from a Halloween party in an aquarium to haunts in Long Island’s historic villages. Be sure to check if you need to buy tickets in advance, and for which ages the activity is appropriate. 150 Holbrook Road, Sachem, NY 11741 631-588-5024 Friday, October 16th, 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM Free event Rock out at this great free event where bands are invited to perform cover songs. All ages are welcome. 86 West Avenue, West Sayville, NY 11796 631-447-8679 Friday, October 23rd, 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM Free event If you haven’t seen this Long Island tradition before, this is the year! Every year, a boat that is deemed unsafe to sail is set ablaze while thousands watch from the shore while enjoying cider and snacks, as well as other activities. 412 Main Street, Port Jefferson, NY 11777 631-928-9100 Saturday, October 24th, 1:00 PM $12 per person Children ages 4 and up can celebrate Halloween in a safe place at this family shindig at the theater! 3rd Street and Wiggins Street, Greenport, NY 11944 631-477-2100 Saturday, October 24th, 4:30 PM - 6:30 PM $50 per person, $45 per person for members The lighthouse will be in ghoulish decor, and visitors can dine on wine and cheese, participate in a costume contest, and enjoy lighthouse ghost stories. Fee includes admission to Bug Light and round-trip ferry passage. 1000 Hempstead Avenue, Rockville Centre, NY 11571 516-323-4444 Saturday, October 24th, 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM Free event Free admission includes trick or treating from 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM at the Molloy College residence halls, bounce houses, face painting, a scarecrow park, pumpkin and mask painting, a haunted house, marshmallow roastings, and cupcake frosting! One Museum Drive, Roslyn Harbor, NY 11576 516-484-9337 Sunday, October 25th, 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM $8 per family Create masks of woodland creatures like owls, bats, foxes and other spooky characters, hear fantastic tales of wild beasts with our storyteller, mix colorful potions with a magical forest inhabitant, and encounter real live creatures! 71 East Main Street, Patchogue, NY 11772 631-207-1313 Sunday, October 25th, 3:00 PM $10-18 per person Back by popular demand, this family-friendly musical is loads of fun, and audience members are encouraged to dress up in their own Halloween costimes! 246 Old Walt Whitman Road, Huntington Station, NY 11746 631-427-5240, ext. 113 Sunday, October 25th, 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM $9 per child, free for chaperones Dress up in your Halloween best and believe in magic once again at this astounding show! 8325 Jericho Turnpike, Woodbury, NY 11797 516-539-0150 ext. 117 Sunday, October 25th, 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM $70 per adult, $30 per child Benefit the less fortunate on LI at this Halloween party, which is packed with entertainment and games for families, including mini golf, giant Jenga, and decorate your own trick or treat tote bag. 3rd Street and Wiggins Street, Greenport, NY 11944 631-477-2100 Saturday, October 25th, 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM $25 per adult, $10 per child (ages 15 and under) Explore the lighthouse, listen to lighthouse ghost stories, play games, and enjoy cider and snacks! Price includes admission and round-trip ferry fare. 2245 Broad Hollow Road (RT. 110), Farmingdale, NY 11735 631-694-6868 Saturday, October 24th - Sunday, October 25th, 11:00 AM - 5:00 PM Free event Enjoy this tradition of free admission, free treats, and free parking at Adventureland as you trick or treat around the park! Rides will be open at the regular price. 150 Holbrook Road, Sachem, NY 11741 631-588-5024 Thursday, October 29th, 1:00 PM - 1:45 PM Free event Preschool students are invited to show off their costumes, parade through the library, collect candy, and listen to stories and songs. Kennedy Plaza, 1 West Chester Street, Long Beach, NY 11561 516-507-8383 Saturday, October 31st, 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM Free event While trick or treating in the plaza, kids can also enjoy live music, a hula hoop contest, a children’s art station, handcrafted arts and crafts, and a costume parade that starts at 11:00 AM. 1 Bay Street, Sag Harbor, NY 11963 631-725-9500 Saturday, October 31st, 8:00 PM $25 per person The dance floor will be packed at this costume dance party with music by the Hoodoo Loungers. 2075 Deer Park Avenue, Deer Park, NY 11729 631-586-0883 Saturday, October 31st, 7:00 PM - 11:00 PM $40 per person Enjoy a delicious buffet dinner, with beer, wine, and soda, and wear your spookiest costume to join in on a costume contest. 161 Main Street, Amagansett, NY 11930 631-267-3117 Saturday, October 31st, 10:00 PM $15 per person
